author: Karen A
comment: Its ok. Uncomplicated app that works. I agree with the other reviews that the limitation of only one recipient is a failing. If that one person doesn't see the sms for whatever reason the alert could be overlooked. The delay on the watch allowing time to cancel could be longer its little more than one second. Five seconds might be better.  Another app like this one has an option to message recipients that the sender is safe and the emergency has passed etc which seems like a useful inclusion. Would like to see a dedicated watch face/complication to make access to the app visually simple. The use of google assistant is a great idea, have yet to try it.

author: Rene Karolyi
comment: I own a LG Urbane 2nd Edition W200 smart watch. I installed your " Emergency Alert for Wear" app. As you might know, the LG Urbane 2nd Edition can work autonomously without a phone connected. It is equipped with its own SIM card. Now you write in the " WHAT'S NEW" section " - Only show a success message if the watch is connected to a phone.". Is this true with the LG Urbane 2nd Edition as well? If yes, it was a drawback, as in the field I use to walk without the phone. Also it might have been stolen or got lost or became not functional due to an accident. In such cases it was maybe a lifesaver and therefore a significant improvement to your app, was such a function available on the watch without a connection to a phone. The number of smartwatches with a SIM card increases every season. So maybe you'll think about making this possible.

author: Brian Baldwin
comment: Works great on moto 360 2 but really need ability to do more than one number on settings
title: Works good, needs ability for more numbers

author: Mainul Islam
comment: PERFECT for Smartwatch wearers to alert someone via text in case of emergencies. Very quick and easy to alert within 1 second, faster than 911.

author: Anna Lampron
comment: Works well and does what it says it will do. However I wish you could send notifications to multiple phone numbers.

author: Connie Brost
comment: Thank you very much!  I'm a senior and this app is invaluable to me.   Works great!
title: Terrific app

author: Shaun hanberger
comment: Used to work great on my HTC u11 but since last update never send a text now and running Android 8

author: Kareem Taha
comment: The app works great in theory, but it doesn't send messages with my phone and watch combination.

author: Matt Ward
comment: Great app that works well. Responsive developer. Recommended!
title: Works perfectly!

author: Andrew Krigel
comment: If universal text to 911 was available this app would be the gold standard, but I dont know of a 24/7 service that accepts SMS.
title: Limited to SMS

author: Troy Westley
comment: Works great on my lg watch
title: Lg watch

author: Martin Brabham
comment: This app saves babies from burning buildings.

author: Steve Pink
comment: I have a Sony Xperia Z2 and a LG urbane,  when asking ok Google it opens a link to the Web and does not send emergency message,  I have sent message to app builder no reply, so I have now deleted the app.
